articles.headline: Pfizer to End Lipitor Ads by Jarvik
articles.snippet: Criticized that its ads are misleading, Pfizer said it would end a campaign using the artificial heart pioneer Robert Jarvik as a spokesman for its cholesterol drug Lipitor.
articles.abstract: Criticized that its ads are misleading, Pfizer said it would end a campaign using the artificial heart pioneer Robert Jarvik as a spokesman for its cholesterol drug Lipitor.
articles.lead_paragraph: Under criticism that its ads are misleading, Pfizer said Monday that it would cancel a long-running advertising campaign using the artificial heart pioneer Robert Jarvik as a spokesman for its cholesterol drug Lipitor.

articles.headline: Pieces of Texas Turn Primary Into a Puzzle
articles.snippet: The rapidly mounting fight in Texas has reminded strategists yet again of the state’s unwieldy size and geographical differences.
articles.abstract: The rapidly mounting fight in Texas has reminded strategists yet again of the state’s unwieldy size and geographical differences.
articles.lead_paragraph: CRAWFORD, Tex.  When Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton issued her gunslinger’s invitation to Senator Barack Obama recently, challenging him to “meet me in Texas,” the question many people here asked was, Which one?

articles.headline: Mergers in a Time of Bears
articles.snippet: An explanation of why deals fail: It’s about timing.
articles.abstract: An explanation of why deals fail: It’s about timing.

articles.headline: Guilty Verdict for 5 in A.I.G. Case
articles.snippet: The executives were found guilty of fraud and conspiracy in a scheme to manipulate the financial statements of the insurance company American International Group.
articles.abstract: The executives were found guilty of fraud and conspiracy in a scheme to manipulate the financial statements of the insurance company American International Group.
articles.lead_paragraph: Five former insurance executives were found guilty Monday of fraud and conspiracy in a scheme to manipulate the financial statements of the insurance company American International Group.

articles.headline: Foreclosure Aid Rising Locally, as Is Dissent
articles.snippet: Efforts to help imperiled homeowners have met resistance from people who consider the assistance undeserved.
articles.abstract: Efforts to help imperiled homeowners have met resistance from people who consider the assistance undeserved.
articles.lead_paragraph: SEATTLE  As the Bush administration and Congress consider proposals to ease the home foreclosure crisis, local governments across the country have been lending money to imperiled homeowners and confronting some opposition.

articles.headline: Ford Is Pushing Buyouts to Workers
articles.snippet: The buyout packages are among the richest ever offered to factory workers, including one-time cash payments of $140,000.
articles.abstract: The buyout packages are among the richest ever offered to factory workers, including one-time cash payments of $140,000.
articles.lead_paragraph: WOODHAVEN, Mich.  The Ford Motor Company is applying the hard sell these days  piling on incentives, doling out marketing DVDs and brochures, and making offers it hopes are too good to pass up.

articles.headline: Obama’s Support Grows Broader, New Poll Finds
articles.snippet: Barack Obama is now viewed by most Democrats as the candidate best able to defeat John McCain, according to the latest New York Times/CBS News Poll.
articles.abstract: Barack Obama is now viewed by most Democrats as the candidate best able to defeat John McCain, according to the latest New York Times/CBS News Poll.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  In the past two months, Senator Barack Obama has built a commanding coalition among Democratic voters, with especially strong support among men, and is now viewed by most Democrats as the candidate best able to beat Senator John McCain in the general election, according to the latest New York Times/CBS News Poll.
articles.byline: By Robin Toner and Dalia Sussman

articles.headline: Visa Plans $17 Billion Public Offer
articles.snippet: Undaunted by recent turbulence in the financial markets, Visa Inc., the nation’s biggest credit card network, said Monday that it would forge ahead with what would be the largest initial public stock offering in United States history.
articles.abstract: Undaunted by recent turbulence in the financial markets, Visa Inc., the nation’s biggest credit card network, said Monday that it would forge ahead with what would be the largest initial public stock offering in United States history.
articles.lead_paragraph: Undaunted by recent turbulence in the financial markets, Visa Inc., the nation’s biggest credit card network, said Monday that it would forge ahead with what would be the largest initial public stock offering in United States history.

articles.headline: Nielsen Looks Beyond TV, and Hits Roadblocks
articles.snippet: Nielsen wants households to let it eavesdrop on Web surfing and cellphone use, but it is finding it a tough sell.
articles.abstract: Nielsen wants households to let it eavesdrop on Web surfing and cellphone use, but it is finding it a tough sell.
articles.lead_paragraph: Being part of a “Nielsen household” has long been a point of pride for people whose television habits are monitored by the Nielsen Company. In exchange for token compensation, these viewers know that their personal taste influences Hollywood and Madison Avenue.
